areas.name: T. Nagar (Thyagaraya Nagar)
areas.description: Chennai's premier shopping district and one of Asia's most densely commercial neighborhoods. This is THE destination for silk sarees, wedding attire, and jewelry. The main shopping stretch along Usman Road and Ranganathan Street offers everything from luxury silk showrooms to budget-friendly options.
tips: Visit on weekday mornings (10 AM - 12 PM) to avoid crowds
Most shops closed on Tuesdays - plan accordingly
Carry cash for better bargaining power at smaller shops
Large showrooms like Nalli and Pothys have fixed prices - no bargaining
Allow 3-4 hours minimum for serious wedding shopping
Take the Chennai Metro to T. Nagar station for easy access
Start with the big showrooms to understand quality and pricing, then explore smaller shops

areas.name: Mylapore
areas.description: Historic Chennai neighborhood known for the iconic Kapaleeshwarar Temple and traditional shopping. Less hectic than T. Nagar with a more authentic old Chennai vibe. Famous for temple jewelry, traditional silk, and artisanal crafts.
tips: Combine shopping with a visit to the beautiful Kapaleeshwarar Temple
Mada Streets around the temple are great for traditional items
Less crowded than T. Nagar, more relaxed shopping experience
Many shops here are family-run for generations
Good for temple jewelry and traditional accessories
Visit in the morning for a peaceful experience

areas.name: Kanchipuram (Day Trip)
areas.description: The silk capital of South India, about 75km from Chennai. Home to the world-famous Kanchipuram silk sarees, woven by master craftsmen for generations. A day trip here offers the chance to buy directly from weavers and witness the artistry firsthand.
tips: Plan a full day - drive takes 1.5-2 hours each way
Visit weaving cooperatives to see sarees being made
Prices are often 15-20% lower than Chennai showrooms
Look for the Silk Mark label for authenticity
Combine with temple visits - Kanchipuram has magnificent temples
Hire a local guide to visit authentic weaver families
Best to visit on weekdays when weavers are actively working
Book a car through your hotel for convenience

Bring a reference photo for custom designs

bargaining: Large showrooms like Nalli, Pothys, RMKV have fixed prices - do not bargain
Smaller independent shops and street vendors expect bargaining - start at 60-70% of quoted price
In Kanchipuram, mild negotiation (10-15%) is acceptable even at established shops
Buying multiple items together can get you a discount even at fixed-price stores
quality: Pure Kanchipuram silk has a unique sheen and weight - ask staff to demonstrate
Check the Silk Mark India label for authenticity certification
Real zari (gold/silver thread) will not tarnish when rubbed
Burn test: pure silk smells like burning hair and leaves ash, synthetic melts
Weight matters: pure Kanchipuram sarees typically weigh 600g-1kg
timing: Most silk shops are closed on Tuesdays - major exception to remember
Festival seasons (Diwali, Pongal) offer sales but also extreme crowds
Weekday mornings (10 AM - 12 PM) are best for personalized attention
Wedding season (January-February) means premium stock but also higher demand
payment: Large showrooms accept all major credit/debit cards
Smaller shops prefer cash - some give 2-5% cash discount
ATMs available throughout T. Nagar and major shopping areas
Keep receipts for customs declarations when leaving India
transport: Chennai Metro has a T. Nagar station - most convenient option
Auto-rickshaws are plentiful but use Ola/Uber for fair pricing
Parking in T. Nagar is extremely difficult - avoid driving if possible
For Kanchipuram day trip, book a car through hotel or use IntrCity buses

Churidar with dupatta for less formal events
